intro: Vibo centropodium, commonly known as the marsh helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its dark green, strap-like leaves and produces showy, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive hooded structure. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, preferring shaded environments with rich, moist soil. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in wetlands, ditches, and along the edges of ponds. Vibo centropodium is known for its ability to thrive in waterlogged conditions, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
